required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study of the Effectiveness and Safety of SHR-1314 for Psoriatic Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Multi-center, Randomized, Double-blind, Placebo-controlled Phase II Dose Exploratory Study to Evaluate the Effectiveness and Safety of SHR-1314 Injection in Adult Subjects With Active Psoriatic Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock: This study is a randomized, double-blind, multicenter, placebo-controlled Phase II clinical study, consisting of a 4-week screening period, a 12-week core treatment period, a 12-week maintenance treatment period, and an 8-week safety follow-up period. It is planned to include 111 adult subjects with psoriatic arthritis.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of subjects achieving ACR 20 improvement at week 12

secondary_outcome.measure: The proportion of subjects who achieved ACR 50 improvement (week 12)
The proportion of subjects who achieved ACR 70 improvement (week 12)
